BlackRock promotes Susan Chan to APAC head, unveils China leadershipThe world's largest asset manager BlackRock on Friday promoted Susan Chan, its deputy head for Asia Pacific to lead the region, a company spokesperson confirmed to Reuters. Fri, 12 Jan 2024 15:59:53 GMT U7QSTW6教堂3DQJWQKEZXSE https://www.reuters.com/business/blackrock-promotes-susan-chan-apac-head-unveils-china-leadership-2024-01-12/Selena Li商业
EV motor maker EuroGroup Laminations to expand production in MexicoElectric motor component maker EuroGroup Laminations said on Friday it would invest 50 million euros ($55 million) to expand its production capacity in Mexico to serve the automotive industry. Fri, 12 Jan 2024 14:35:54 GMT 2PU6SMIGZJPNJGVAATU7GEPYUQ https://www.reuters.com/business/auto-transportation/ev-engine-maker-eurogroup-laminations-expand-production-mexico-2024-01-12/Reuters商业汽车与交通
China urges better financing coordination for housing sectorChina's housing ministry and financial regulator asked local governments to better coordinate with financial institutions to provide financing support to real estate projects, as policymakers work to revive the sluggish housing market. China's 2023 bank lending at record high, but economy still strugglingNew bank lending in China rose less than expected in December, but 2023 lending hit a new record as the central bank kept policy accommodative to support an unexpectedly shaky economic recovery. Fri, 12 Jan 2024 11:26:26 GMT B26ZCDHZ3FKGTKLJVXURHTWL5Y https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/chinas-2023-bank-lending-record-high-economy-still-struggling-2024-01-12/Judy Hua, Kevin Yao市场亚洲市场
In moon race with China, U.S. setbacks test role of private firmsTwo U.S. setbacks this week in the race to the moon with China illustrate the risks of NASA's plans to bet on a new strategy of relying heavily on private companies. Fri, 12 Jan 2024 11:08:41 GMT 2BACK DUZM5RPNVLCZLCTSE6M https://www.reuters.com/science/moon-race-with-china-us-setbacks-test-role-of-private-firms-2024-01-12/Joey Roulette, Nivedita Bhattacharjee, Ryan Woo科学
Weak demand, tighter lenders: Hong Kong property developers face tough 2024Hong Kong's property companies face a squeeze in 2024 from rising funding costs and sluggish home sales and office rentals, making creditors and investors cautious about developers’ financial health.
